business.headline: Sensex tumbles over 900 points, Nifty ends below 23,000; IT, metal stocks crashThe S&P BSE Sensex tumbled 930.67 points to 75,364.69 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 345.65 points to settle at 22,904.45.

IT stocks bleed as market crashes. Why TCS, Infosys, Wipro shares are down?All major IT stocks declined as fears of a US recession led to heavy selling. IT companies earn a large portion of their revenue from the US market, and concerns about a slowdown in technology spending have further weakened investor sentiment.

With 'fancy ice-cream' jab, Piyush Goyal's cold message to Shark Tank judgesPiyush Goyal row: While flagging the trend of Indian startups focusing on 'fancy ice creams' and food delivery apps, Piyush Goyal drew a parallel with China to pitch for more innovation in deep-tech.

RIL share price falls 4% ahead of Q4 results. Should you sell?Reliance Industries stock: RIL shares opened at Rs 1,240 and fell to an intraday low of Rs 1,192.85 in the afternoon session. The stock was close to its 52-week low of Rs 1,156, which it touched on March 3, 2025.

US tariffs stay at 26% as White House unveils new trade documentInitially, India's tariff rate was mentioned as 27% in the earlier version of the White House annex. However, the latest revision has adjusted it to 26%.

Withdrawing EPF? Know rules for marriage, education, home and medical needsIf you require money out of your EPF for the purposes of marriage or further studies, there are set regulations one needs to adhere to. You must have been an EPF member for at least seven years and must have at least Rs 1,000 in your EPF account.

Politicians need reality check, says Ashneer Grover on Piyush Goyal's startup remarkAshneer Grover has said that Indian politicians need a reality check after Piyush Goyal criticised startups for being too focused on food delivery apps.

Pension rules updates: 8 RBI guidelines every pensioner must knowIf a bank accidentally credits more pension than it should to a pensioner, then the bank must consult the Pension Sanctioning Authority before recovering the extra money.
Explained: Why Tata Motors share price has fallen 5% todayTata Motors share price: Tata Motors has gone down 8.68% in the last 5 days, 33.43% in the past month and 38.75% in the last year.

Piyush Goyal slams Indian startups, urges to shift focus from food delivery appsUnion Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal criticised India's startup ecosystem, saying it's too focused on food delivery, betting, and fantasy sports apps. In contrast, he praised Chinese startups for prioritising advanced tech like EVs, batteries, semiconductors, and AI, urging Indian innovators to shift toward deeper, tech-driven innovation.

Sensex crashes 1,000 points: 3 reasons behind today's stock market bloodbathStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 965.90 points to 75,329.46, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 361.10 points to 22,889.00 as of 2:08 pm.

Storm of protest from startups after Minister Piyush Goyal's 'dukaandari' jibeStartup ecosystem leaders' response came after Piyush Goyal took a firm stance and said that while Indian startups were busy building food delivery platforms and fantasy gaming apps, those in countries like China were working on EVs, semiconductors, batteries, and AI.

entertainment.headline: Shakira's 2025 Tour is here – Find out where she's performing in the USShakira expands her Las Mujeres Ya No Lloran World Tour, adding US dates. Fans can buy tickets from April 7. The tour celebrates Latin culture, unity, and record-breaking performances.

Khloé Kardashian and Tristan Thompson reunite for his brother Amari's birthdayKhloé Kardashian reunited with Tristan Thompson for his brother Amari's 18th birthday, emphasizing her close bond with his family. Despite their breakup, she continues to support Amari, whom Tristan now has legal custody of.

Empuraan: Voluntary or not, the cuts that shouldn't have beenEmpuraan's re-edited version trims two minutes to appease offended parties - an unnecessary sacrifice. This paradise of wounded people showcases our remarkable talent for manufacturing outrage from triviality.

Aamar Boss teaser: Raakhee Gulzar's comeback film promises heartfelt momentsThe teaser of Aamar Boss, which marks Raakhee Gulzar's return after 22 years and features Shiboprosad Mukherjee, is out. The film, directed by Nandita Roy and Shiboprosad Mukherjee, is set for a May 9 release, before Mother's Day.
MTV Video Music Awards to hit CBS screens for the first timeThe MTV Video Music Awards will air on CBS for the first time on Sept. 7, live from UBS Arena.
Sara Ali Khan visits Chandramouleshwara temple in KarnatakaActor Sara Ali Khan recently visited Chandramouleshwar Temple in Unkal. She shared pictures from the trip on social media.

Dhanush announces Idly Kadai release date with a special posterDhanush, who acted and helmed Idly Kadai, announced the film's release date with a poster. The film was earlier scheduled to release on April 10.

Rashmika Mandanna to celebrate 29th birthday in Oman with friendsPushpa star Rashmika Mandanna is all set to celebrate her 29th birthday in Oman. The actor was recently seen sharing screen space with Salman Khan in Sikandar.

It bothers me: Kim Sae-ron's leaked texts to Kim Soo-hyun hint at unhappy relationKorean actor Kim Soo-hyun continues to battle allegations about dating the late actor Kim Sae-ron when she was a minor. A set of new alleged text-exchanges alleges that she was not happy in their relationship.

Ameesha Patel backs Salman-Rashmika pairing in Sikandar, dismisses age gap debateActor Ameesha Patel recently shared her views on the ongoing discussion about the age difference between Salman Khan and Rashmika Mandanna in Sikandar.

Test review: Madhavan, Nayanthara and Siddharth hit sixes, but don't win the matchReleased-Fri Apr 04, 2025Test movie review: Producer-turned-director Sashikanth's 'Test', starring Madhavan, Siddharth and Nayanthara, is a sports drama about a winner and a loser. The trio's star power failed to deliver an enjoyable innings.

When Manoj Kumar filed defamation case against SRK: He has injured my soulVeteran actor Manoj Kumar was upset with a scene in the 2007 film Om Shanti Om, leading to legal action against Shah Rukh Khan and director Farah Khan. Despite an apology and promises to remove the scene, the issue resurfaced in 2013 when the film was re-released in Japan with the scene intact.

SS Rajamouli-Mahesh Babu's next will not be released in two parts: ReportDirector SS Rajamouli will reportedly not be releasing his next film, starring Mahesh Babu and Priyanka Chopra, in two installments.

Empuraan box office Day 8: Rs 100 crore confirmed by 2nd weekend for Mohanlal's filmMohanlal's 'L2: Empuraan' has entered its second weekend at the box office. The film is inching closer to the Rs 100 crore benchmark at the domestic box office.

Ghost-writing to becoming India's Bharat Kumar: Iconic legacy of Manoj KumarLegendary actor Manoj Kumar died on Friday at around 3.30 am in Mumbai. He was 87. We trace his journey in this tribute piece, highlighting what he really stood for.

Sikandar box office day 5: Salman Khan's film inches close to Rs 100 crore markSikandar box office collection Day 5: Salman Khan's action drama Sikandar continues to struggle at the domestic box office. The film, directed by AR Murugadoss, earned Rs 90 crore in just five days.
How Manoj Kumar earned the title 'Bharat Kumar'Veteran actor Manoj Kumar has died. He was 87. Kumar had earned the moniker 'Bharat Kumar' for his work in Hindi cinema.

When Manoj Kumar called Akshay Kumar his true successorVeteran actor Manoj Kumar has died at 87. The late artiste once called Bollywood star Akshay Kumar his 'true successor' when it came to portraying a country-loving person on screen.
Akshay Kumar, Khushbu Sundar and celebs mourn Manoj Kumar's deathAkshay Kumar, Khusbhu Sundar, among other celebrities, condoled the death of Manoj Kumar. The veteran actor died at 87.

Avoid rhetoric that vitiates environment, ensure safety of Hindus: PM to YunusPM Modi's remarks come against the backdrop of Muhammad Yunus inviting China to expand its influence in India's Northeast. The comments were strongly denounced by India.

Waqf amendment bill owned the headlines, what's behind and beyond?After two days of hectic debates in both Houses, stretching well past midnight, the Waqf Amendment Bill passed the Parliament hurdle on Friday. In this article, we dive deep into the history of waqf, the provisions of the bill, and what the controversy is all about.

How Turkey's Hagia Sophia, once a cathedral, became Waqf propertyThe Hagia Sophia is at the centre of Turkey's Byzantine, Ottoman and secular history. How did the sixth-century cathedral become a Waqf property, get converted to a museum, and again a mosque? Tracing the history of the Hagia Sophia amid the Waqf Bill debate in India.

MK Stalin calls meeting with MLAs after Centre denies state's NEET exemption pleaTamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has called for a meeting of all MLAs in the state on April 9 after the Centre rejected the state's plea for NEET exemption. "NEET disproportionately benefits urban students who can afford expensive coaching centres," said Stalin.

'Daredevil' US man who entered Andaman's restricted island met Taliban previouslyAmerican YouTuber Mykhailo Viktorovych Polyakov, was arrested for attempting to make contact with one of the world's most isolated tribes on North Sentinel Island, had previously visited Taliban-controlled Afghanistan and shared videos.

Satellite images confirm deforestation in Hyderabad's Kancha Gachibowli areaSatellite images show the deforestation near Hyderabad Central University for an IT park in Telangana. The felling of trees sparked outrage, leading to student protests and Supreme Court intervention amid questions over environmental clearance and the ecological sensitivity of Kancha Gachibowli region.

India is our fastest growing ChatGPT market, says OpenAI COOJust a day after OpenAI CEO Sam Altman called the AI adoption in India "amazing", the company's COO has shared a post on X saying India is their fastest growing ChatGPT market.

Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates shares the coolest code he has ever writtenOn the 50th anniversary of Microsoft, co-founder Bill Gates shares the code that started it all. He has made it available to download for all on his blog.

Fire reported at Andhra Pradesh Secretariat block housing Pawan Kalyan's officeA minor fire in the second block of Andhra Pradesh Secretariat damaged the UPS room, where it had erupted. The blaze was brought under control within 20 minutes and no one was reported hurt.

Kanche Gachibowli: Revanth Reddy's first big political missstepLast month, Hyderabad residents learned about the sale of Kanche Gachibowli, a 400-acre land parcel strategically located at the junction of the Gachibowli financial district and CR Rao Road.

Rohit Sharma's bizarre chat with Zaheer goes viral: 'Jab karna tha, maine kiya'Mumbai Indians' batter Rohit Sharma's chat with Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) mentor Zaheer Khan has been going viral on social media as his conversation is being seen as a comment on his form.

Fiery wind from the Sun made Jupiter crack in 2017This phenomenon, reported for the first time, resulted in temperatures exceeding 500°C, significantly higher than the typical background temperature of 350°C.
Internet explodes with memes as Trump slaps tariffs on islands inhabited by penguinsHeard Island and McDonald Islands, an external Australian territory, are among the most isolated places on Earth.

Yunus raises Sheikh Hasina's extradition in 1st meet with PM amid strained tiesSources said Bangladesh sought a meeting between Muhammad Yunus and PM Modi on the sidelines of the BIMSTEC summit. The meeting comes amid strained ties between the neighbours.

Watch: Trump unveils $5 million gold card for citizenship; rollout by...Donald Trump introduced a $5 million "gold card" for wealthy migrants, calling it a symbol of exclusivity. He claimed to be the first buyer and announced its release within two weeks.

sports.headline: IPL 2025: AI predicts winner of LSG vs MI clashAs Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) take on Mumbai Indians (MI) in Match 16 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025), we asked AI to predict the winner of the mouth-watering clash.

BCCI defends Delhi Test in November: Pollution issue doesn't happen every yearBoard of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) secretary Devajit Saikia has come out in defence of their decision to host a Test match in Delhi in the month of November. India are set to play the first Test against South Africa on 18th November at Arun Jaitely Stadium in New Delhi.

Neeraj Chopra Classic javelin competition in May 2025: All you need to knowThe Neeraj Chopra Classic javelin throw competition is all set to make its debut on May 24, bringing the Olympic star back to Indian soil after more than a year. With global athletes in attendance, the competition has already received the World Athletics category 'A' recognition.

NBA: Luka Doncic gifts BTS' J-Hope unreleased sneakers at Lakers gameDuring the Los Angeles Lakers vs Golden State Warriors NBA regular game on Thursday, April 3, Lakers Guard Luka Doncic had a brief interaction with the BTS member J-Hope, who was on the courtside.

IPL 2025: Kolkata Knight Riders achieve unprecedented feat after beating SRHKolkata Knight Riders (KKR) achieved an unprecedented feat after beating Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) in Match 15 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025). The Ajinkya Rahane-led side won the match by 80 runs at Eden Gardens, Kolkata.

Watch: Pandya's 'be prepared' pep talk to MI's new star Ashwani KumarMumbai Indians skipper Hardik Pandya gave a pep talk to Ashwani Kumar, urging the debutant to carry forward his fiery form against LSG. With both sides desperate for momentum, the stage is set for the youngster to shine again under pressure.

Mark Chapman ruled out of third ODI vs Pakistan due to hamstring injuryNew Zealand batter Mark Chapman has been ruled out of the third ODI vs Pakistan due to a hamstring injury. Chapman scored a magnificent hundred in the series opener in Napier.

LSG vs MI, IPL 2025: When Nicholas Pooran thrashed Mumbai in 2024 showdownLucknow Super Giants will look to repeat last year's dominant win over Mumbai Indians. Nicholas Pooran's heroics from last year and the Ekana advantage give them a perfect chance to turn their IPL 2025 campaign around against the struggling five-time champions.

Target was gettable, we didn't get the start we wanted: James FranklinSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) bowling coach James Franklin feels that their team would've chased down the target of 201 against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR), but they didn't get the start they wanted. SRH got all out for just 120 in 16.4 overs at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata and lost their third consecutive game.

Didn't get it quite right: Franklin rues poor death bowling against KKRIPL 2025, KKR vs SRH: Sunrisers Hyderabad bowling coach James Franklin said that the Orange Army faltered in the death overs against Kolkata Knight Riders where they leaked 66 runs in their last four overs.

Don't want to be a team which scores 250 and get out for 70 next day: Venkatesh IyerKolkata Knight Riders all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer has said that their team focuses more on showing positive and correct intent after his match-winning innings vs Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH). He stressed that aggression doesn't mean tonking every ball for six but understanding and using the conditions in one's favour.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
